page.title: 03Coal mining in Pontycymer
page.content: Pontycymer, along with the rest of the Garw valley was the last area in the South Wales coal industry to be developed, its mineral wealth not being realised until the 1870's. the potential of Pontycymer and the surrounding area as a coal mining region was discovered by Edward Plumber, and imediately deep mining began. Several mines were sunk:- The Ffaldau colliery -1878-1983 The Garw(Ocean) colliery -1886-? The International(Carne) -1884-1968 The Victoria Level -1874-1878 The Glengarw -1906-1959 The Lluest colliery -closed in 1899 The Darren colliery After 1913, the coal industry in pontycymer began to decline due to a variety of economic reasons, today only "The Garw" remains open.
